software.bernie.geckolib.animation.controller

Class AnimationController<T extends IAnimatedEntity>

  • java.lang.Object
    • software.bernie.geckolib.animation.controller.AnimationController<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type parameter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EntityAnimationController

    public abstract class AnimationController<T extends IAnimatedEntity>
extends java.lang.Object
    The type Animation controller.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  AnimationController.IAnimationPredicate<P>
      An AnimationPredicate is run every render frame for ever AnimationController.
      static interface  AnimationController.ICustomInstructionListener
      Custom instructions can be added in blockbench by enabling animation effects in Animation - Animate Effects.
      static interface  AnimationController.IParticleListener
      Particle Listeners are run when a sound keyframe is hit.
      static interface  AnimationController.ISoundListener
      Sound Listeners are run when a sound keyframe is hit.

      • easingType

        public EasingType easingType
        By default Geckolib uses the easing types of every keyframe. If you want to override that for an entire AnimationController, change this value.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnimationController

        protected AnimationController(T entity,
                              java.lang.String name,
                              float transitionLengthTicks)
        Instantiates a new Animation controller. Each animation controller can run one animation at a time. You can have several animation controllers for each entity, i.e. one animation to control the entity's size, one to control movement, attacks, etc.
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity
        name - Name of the animation controller (move_controller, size_controller, attack_controller, etc.)
        transitionLengthTicks - How long it takes to transition between animations (IN TICKS!!)

      • AnimationController

        public AnimationController(T entity,
                           java.lang.String name,
                           float transitionLengthTicks,
                           EasingType easingtype)
        Instantiates a new Animation controller. Each animation controller can run one animation at a time. You can have several animation controllers for each entity, i.e. one animation to control the entity's size, one to control movement, attacks, etc.
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity
        name - Name of the animation controller (move_controller, size_controller, attack_controller, etc.)
        transitionLengthTicks - How long it takes to transition between animations (IN TICKS!!)
        easingtype - The method of easing to use. The other constructor defaults to no easing.

      • AnimationController

        public AnimationController(T entity,
                           java.lang.String name,
                           float transitionLengthTicks,
                           java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> customEasingMethod)
        Instantiates a new Animation controller. Each animation controller can run one animation at a time. You can have several animation controllers for each entity, i.e. one animation to control the entity's size, one to control movement, attacks, etc.
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity
        name - Name of the animation controller (move_controller, size_controller, attack_controller, etc.)
        transitionLengthTicks - How long it takes to transition between animations (IN TICKS!!)
        customEasingMethod - If you want to use an easing method that's not included in the EasingType enum, pass your method into here. The parameter that's passed in will be a number between 0 and 1. Return a number also within 0 and 1. Take a look at EasingManager

      • process

        public void process(double tick,
                    AnimationTestEvent animationTestEvent,
                    java.util.List<AnimatedModelRenderer> modelRendererList,
                    BoneSnapshotCollection boneSnapshotCollection)
        This method is called every frame in order to populate the animation point queues, and process animation state logic.
        Parameters:
        tick - The current tick + partial tick
        animationTestEvent - The animation test event
        modelRendererList - The list of all AnimatedModelRender's
        boneSnapshotCollection - The bone snapshot collection
